sentences.chinese: 出于内疚，他以前总是给他们买昂贵的礼物。

sentences.english: He felt an enormous sense of guilt when he thought about how he’d treated her.
sentences.chinese: 他想到自己那样对待她，心里非常歉疚。

sentences.english: He did not deny his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 他没有否认自己有罪。

sentences.english: His guilt was proved beyond all doubt by the prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 他的罪行已被原告方证实确凿无疑。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of shame and sadness because you know that you have done something wrong

sentences.english: Dave’s a nice guy when you get to know him.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫是个好人，你了解他后就知道了。

sentences.english: Jake’s a real tough guy.
sentences.chinese: 杰克是个很厉害的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: a man

sentences.english: Regular exercise is a good habit.
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼是个好习惯。

sentences.english: Thinking negatively can become a habit.
sentences.chinese: 消极的思维方式会成为一种习惯。

sentences.english: She has a habit of playing with her hair when she’s nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她有一个习惯，一紧张就拨弄自己的头发。

sentences.english: Some people drink alcohol as much from habit as from desire.
sentences.chinese: 有些人喝酒既是因为想喝，也是出于习惯。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do regularly or usually, often without thinking about it because you have done it so many times before

sentences.english: a huge tiled entrance hall
sentences.chinese: 铺着地砖的大门厅

sentences.english: Each floor had ten rooms on both sides of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 每一层在走廊的两边都各有十个房间。

detailed_translations.english: the area just inside the door of a house or other building, that leads to other rooms

sentences.english: The boy picked up a handful of stones and started throwing them at us.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩捡起一把石子，开始朝我们扔过来。

sentences.english: There were only a handful of people there.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：那里只有几个人。

detailed_translations.english: an amount that you can hold in your hand

name: handle
trans: n .柄，把手；vt . 触摸，处理，操作

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

sentences.english: a pair of expensive handmade shoes
sentences.chinese: 一双昂贵的手工制作的鞋子

detailed_translations.english: made by people using their hands, not by a machine

sentences.english: He greeted me with a handshake and a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 他与我握手问候，并递给我一杯酒。

sentences.english: Her handshake was warm and firm.
sentences.chinese: 她的握手温暖而有力。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking someone’s right hand and shaking it, which people do when they meet or leave each other or when they have made an agreement

name: hang
trans: n . 悬挂；vt . 悬挂， 垂下；vi. 悬着， 垂下，被绞死

sentences.english: Philip hung his coat on a hook behind the door.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普把自己的大衣挂在门后的钩子上。

sentences.english: She hung the sheets on the washing line.
sentences.chinese: 她把床单晾在晒衣绳上。

detailed_translations.chinese: [hung-hung] 悬挂， 吊； 徘徊； [hanged-hanged] 吊
detailed_translations.english: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground

sentences.english: My parents divorced when I was six, and I hardly knew my father.
sentences.chinese: 我六岁时父母离婚，我对父亲几乎一无所知。

sentences.english: The children were so excited they could hardly speak.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们兴奋得几乎连话都说不出来了。

sentences.english: I can hardly believe it.
sentences.chinese: 这简直让我难以置信。

sentences.english: (= almost no one ) writes to me these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今几乎没有人给我写信了。

sentences.english: Dad ate hardly anything (= almost nothing ).
sentences.chinese: 爸爸几乎没吃什么东西。

sentences.english: There was hardly any (= very little ) traffic.
sentences.chinese: 路上车少人稀。

sentences.english: She lives in Spain, so we hardly ever (= almost never ) see her.
sentences.chinese: 她住在西班牙，所以我们几乎见不到她。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: harvest
trans: n .收获， 收成 ，成果；v.收获， 收割

sentences.english: every year at harvest time
sentences.chinese: 每年在收获的季节

sentences.english: Plum growers are expecting a bumper harvest this year.
sentences.chinese: 种植李树的农民期盼着今年有个好收成。

detailed_translations.english: the time when crops are gathered from the fields, or the act of gathering them
to gather crops from the fields

sentences.english: a preacher who claims that he can heal the sick
sentences.chinese: 自称可以治病的传道士

sentences.english: The rift between the two younger men never healed.
sentences.chinese: 两个较年轻者之间的裂痕从未得以弥合。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone who is ill become healthy again, especially by using natural powers or prayer

name: heat
trans: n . 高温，压力， 热度；vt . 使激动，把…加热

sentences.english: Ice needs heat to melt.
sentences.chinese: 冰需要热才能融化。

sentences.english: Insulating the attic is a good way to reduce heat loss.
sentences.chinese: 为阁楼安装隔热层是减少热量流失的好方法。

sentences.english: The heat was making them tired.
sentences.chinese: 炎热的天气令他们疲倦。

sentences.english: Heat the milk until it boils.
sentences.chinese: 把牛奶煮开。

detailed_translations.english: warmth or the quality of being hot
to make something become warm or hot

sentences.english: He began to feel depressed and helpless.
sentences.chinese: 他开始觉得沮丧、无助。

sentences.english: a vicious attack on a helpless victim
sentences.chinese: 对无助受害者的残暴攻击

sentences.english: Newman threw out a hand in a helpless gesture.
sentences.chinese: 纽曼伸出手做了个无助的手势。

detailed_translations.english: unable to look after yourself or to do anything to help yourself

sentences.english: He had dared to speak out against injustice, and overnight he became a national hero .
sentences.chinese: 他敢于站出来抨击不公正的现象，一夜之间就成了国家英雄。

sentences.english: His father was a war hero , a former fighter pilot.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲是一位战争英雄，曾经是战斗机飞行员。

sentences.english: the unsung heroes who drove convoys of aid to Bosnia
sentences.chinese: 运载援助物品到波斯尼亚的那些无名英雄

sentences.english: A man hailed as a hero for 50 years has been unmasked as a traitor.
sentences.chinese: 50年来一直被誉为英雄的人被揭发为叛徒。

sentences.english: The hero of Doctor Zhivago dies in 1929.
sentences.chinese: 《日瓦戈医生》的男主人公于1929年去世。

detailed_translations.english: a man who is admired for doing something extremely brave

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: hill
trans: n . 小山，丘陵 ， 山岗

sentences.english: Their house is on a hill overlooking the sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们的房子建在可以俯视大海的小山上。

sentences.english: A cart was making its way up the hill.
sentences.chinese: 一辆马车正在爬上山丘。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land that is higher than the land around it, like a mountain but smaller

sentences.english: places of historical interest
sentences.chinese: 历史名胜

sentences.english: It is important to look at the novel in its historical context .
sentences.chinese: 在历史背景下看待这部小说很重要。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the past

sentences.english: Throughout history the achievements of women have been largely ignored.
sentences.chinese: 从古至今，妇女的成就都被大大地忽视了。

sentences.english: No man in recent history has done more to rebuild the Democratic Party.
sentences.chinese: 他对重建民主党的贡献在近代史上无人能及。

sentences.english: the early history of Scotland
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰的早期历史

sentences.english: Other meteor storms have occurred in recorded history .
sentences.chinese: 在有记载的历史上发生过其他的流星暴。

sentences.english: a museum devoted to local history
sentences.chinese: 专门介绍当地历史的博物馆

sentences.english: one of the darkest episodes in American history
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上最黑暗的事件之一

sentences.english: an interesting period in Egyptian history
sentences.chinese: 埃及历史上一段有趣的时期

sentences.english: a decision that changed the course of history
sentences.chinese: 改变历史进程的决定

sentences.english: a college steeped in history
sentences.chinese: 一所历史悠久的学院

sentences.english: Your doctor will ask for your medical history.
sentences.chinese: 医生会询问你的病历。

detailed_translations.english: all the things that happened in the past, especially the political, social, or economic development of a nation

name: hit
trans: n .打击，打 ；vt .打，打击 ，击中；vi.打，打中，打击

sentences.english: Which band had a hit with ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’?
sentences.chinese: 《波希米亚狂想曲》是哪支乐队风行一时的歌曲？

detailed_translations.english: something such as a film, play, song etc that is very popular and successful

sentences.english: What are your hobbies?
sentences.chinese: 你有些什么爱好？

sentences.english: Susan’s hobbies include reading, cooking, and drama.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊的业余爱好包括阅读、烹饪和戏剧。

sentences.english: Retirement gave him the time to pursue his hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 退休以后他有充裕的时间来做自己喜欢做的事。

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you enjoy doing in your free time

sentences.english: Thousands of people have been made homeless .
sentences.chinese: 成千上万人被逼得无家可归。

detailed_translations.english: without a home

sentences.english: For homework, finish the exercise on page 14.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业是完成第14页的练习。

detailed_translations.english: work that a student at school is asked to do at home

sentences.english: He was a hard-working, honest man.
sentences.chinese: 他勤奋老实。

sentences.english: Ann had an honest face.
sentences.chinese: 安有一张诚实的面孔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal

sentences.english: Hi, honey.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，亲爱的。

detailed_translations.english: a sweet sticky substance produced by  bees  , used as food

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…说甜言蜜语；加蜜使甜

name: hopeless
trans: adj. 没有希望的，绝望的

sentences.english: We tried to stop the flames from spreading, but we knew it was hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 我们试图阻止火势蔓延，但我们知道这是不可能的。

sentences.english: Getting your work published often seems a hopeless task.
sentences.chinese: 想让自己的作品出版似乎总是徒劳的。

sentences.english: I kept on struggling forward, even though I knew it was hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 虽然知道无望，我还是奋力挣扎向前。

sentences.english: I began to feel lonely and hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 我开始感到寂寞绝望。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you try to do is hopeless, there is no possibility of it being successful

sentences.english: They are building a new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在建一家新医院。

detailed_translations.english: a large building where sick or injured people receive medical treatment

sentences.english: Thanks for your hospitality over the past few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你几周来的热情款待。

detailed_translations.english: friendly behaviour towards visitors

sentences.english: Men are doing more housework nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 现今男人正在承担越来越多的家务。

detailed_translations.english: work that you do to take care of a house, for example washing, cleaning etc

name: humid
trans: adj. 潮湿的； 湿润的

sentences.english: Tokyo is extremely humid in mid-summer.
sentences.chinese: 仲夏的东京十分潮湿。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

sentences.english: I like your sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你的 幽默感。

sentences.english: His remarks participated of the sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 他的话里带有几分幽默感。

sentences.english: She loved everything about him -- his personality, his humor, the way he dressed.
sentences.chinese: 她爱他的一切——他的性格，他的幽默，还有他的衣着打扮。

name: hurry
trans: v. 急速， 匆忙； n . 匆忙，仓促

sentences.english: If we hurry, we’ll get there in time.
sentences.chinese: 要是赶紧的话，我们能及时到那里。

sentences.english: I hate having to hurry a meal.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌匆匆忙忙地吃饭。

sentences.english: We’ll have to hurry, otherwise we’ll miss the start.
sentences.chinese: 我们得赶紧，否则就会错过开头部分了。

sentences.english: There’s no need to hurry. We’ve got plenty of time.
sentences.chinese: 不必匆忙，我们有的是时间。

detailed_translations.english: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time
to make someone do something more quickly

sentences.english: Have you met my husband Roy?
sentences.chinese: 你见过我的丈夫罗伊吗？

detailed_translations.english: the man that a woman is married to

name: ideally
trans: adv.理想地，在观念上地， 完美地

sentences.english: Ideally, your car should have high-security locks.
sentences.chinese: 最理想的情况是，你的车应该配有高度安全的车锁。

sentences.english: Fruit and vegetables should ideally be organically grown.
sentences.chinese: 水果和蔬菜最理想的应该是有机种植。

detailed_translations.english: used to describe the way you would like things to be, even though this may not be possible

name: identity
trans: n . 同一性， 身份，一致

sentences.english: The identity of the killer is still unknown.
sentences.chinese: 凶手的身份仍未查明。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s identity is their name or who they are

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

sentences.english: illegal drugs
sentences.chinese: 违禁药品

sentences.english: They were involved in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 他们参与了非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: not allowed by the law

name: image
trans: n . 图象，  肖像；vt . 想象，作... 的像

sentences.english: attempts to improve the image of the police
sentences.chinese: 提升警察形象的努力

sentences.english: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
sentences.chinese: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

sentences.english: He retired immediately after the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争一结束他就退休了。

sentences.english: Those most immediately involved in the disaster will be given support.
sentences.chinese: 灾害最直接受害者将获得援助。

detailed_translations.english: very soon before or after something

name: impact
trans: n .碰撞 冲击 冲突 影响 效果vt .挤入 撞击 压紧 对...发生影响

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

name: impatient
trans: adj.不耐烦的， 急躁的，不耐心的

sentences.english: One thing I’ve noticed is that when people have to wait, they become impatient or uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到一件事，就是当人们在等待的时候，人们会变的没有耐心、焦躁不安。

name: import
trans: n .进 口货，  进 口，重要性；v.输入，进 口

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

name: inactive
trans: adj.无行动的，不活动的， 怠惰的

sentences.english: The brain cells are inactive during sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在睡觉时脑细胞不活跃。

sentences.english: Young people are becoming politically inactive.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人变得不热衷政治了。

detailed_translations.english: not doing anything, not working, or not moving

name: incident
trans: n .事件， 事变； adj. 易于发生的

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
sentences.chinese: 因为发生重大事故，道路被封锁了。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

sentences.english: Monday’s a bit inconvenient for me. How about Wednesday?
sentences.chinese: 周一我不太方便，周三如何？

sentences.english: Am I calling at an inconvenient time?
sentences.chinese: 我电话打得不是时候吧？

detailed_translations.english: causing problems, often in a way that is annoying

name: increase
trans: n .增加，增大，增长；v.增加 ，加大

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

sentences.english: Marketing techniques are becoming increasingly sophisticated.
sentences.chinese: 市场营销技巧越来越巧妙。

sentences.english: Increasingly, young people distrust all forms of government.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人越来越不相信任何形式的政府。

detailed_translations.english: more and more all the time

sentences.english: The blood tests prove that Vince is indeed the father.
sentences.chinese: 验血证明文斯确实是父亲。

sentences.english: ‘Would it help if you had an assistant?’ ‘It would indeed.’
sentences.chinese: “你要是有个助手，会有帮助吗？”“那是肯定的。

sentences.english: Most of the essays were very good indeed.
sentences.chinese: 这些文章大多数都非常好。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize a statement or answer

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: individual
trans: n .个人，个体； adj.个别的，单独的，个人的

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

sentences.english: an indoor swimming pool
sentences.chinese: 室内游泳池

sentences.english: the world indoor athletics championship
sentences.chinese: 世界室内田径锦标赛

sentences.english: Too much central heating can harm indoor plants.
sentences.chinese: 中央供暖系统温度太高对室内植物有害。

detailed_translations.english: used or happening inside a building

sentences.english: I work in the oil industry.
sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.english: Italy’s thriving tourist industry
sentences.chinese: 意大利蓬勃发展的旅游业

sentences.english: Gould is a man of great industry.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德是一个很勤劳的人。

detailed_translations.english: businesses that produce a particular type of thing or provide a particular service

sentences.english: a good selection of inexpensive wines
sentences.chinese: 可供选择的各种价格公道的葡萄酒

sentences.english: Painting is a relatively inexpensive way to enhance your home.
sentences.chinese: 粉刷是美化居室的一种相对较便宜的方式。

detailed_translations.english: cheap – use this to show approval

name: influence
trans: n .影响，感化， 势力；vt .影响， 改变

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: information
trans: n .通知， 消息， 资料，信息

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

sentences.english: We’re staying at the Holiday Inn.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在假日酒店。

detailed_translations.english: a small hotel or pub, especially an old one in the countryside

sentences.english: an insect bite
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的叮咬

sentences.english: flying insects
sentences.chinese: 飞虫

sentences.english: Don’t forget to bring insect repellant (= a chemical to keep insects away ).
sentences.chinese: 不要忘记带上驱虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

name: inspire
trans: vt . 激发，鼓舞，启示，产生，使生灵感

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: instance
trans: n .实例，建议， 情况 ；vt .举... 为例

sentences.english: In this instance I think she was mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上我认为她弄错了。

detailed_translations.english: an example of a particular kind of situation

sentences.english: All four victims died instantly.
sentences.chinese: 四名受害人全部当即死亡。

sentences.english: The information was instantly available.
sentences.chinese: 信息即时可得。

detailed_translations.english: immediately

name: instruct
trans: vt .教导，命令，指示，通知；<衍生词> inst ruction n .指示， 用法说明，指导，指令

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: intend
trans: vt . 想要，打算， 意指

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

name: interact
trans: vi.互相作用，互相影响；<衍生词> interaction  n .交互作用，交感

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: internal
trans: adj. 内在的，  国内的

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country
The Internet is the network that allows computer users to connect with computers all over the world, and that carries e-mail

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: interview
trans: vt .接见，会见； n .接见，会见

sentences.english: a portfolio of work presented at interview
sentences.chinese: 在面试时呈递的工作成果样本

sentences.english: a police interview
sentences.chinese: 警方问讯

sentences.english: We’re interviewing six candidates for the job.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作我们要面试六名申请人。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out whether they are suitable for a job, course of study etc
to ask someone questions during an interview

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell, the inventor of the telephone
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔，电话的发明者

detailed_translations.english: someone who has invented something, or whose job is to invent things

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

name: issue
trans: n . 问题，结果；vt .使流出， 发行

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

sentences.english: He opened the cardboard box and took out each item.
sentences.chinese: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。

sentences.english: The store is having a sale on furniture and household items.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

sentences.english: luxury items such as exotic spices and perfumes
sentences.chinese: 异国香料和香水之类的奢侈品

sentences.english: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item (= one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable ).
sentences.chinese: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项，一件，一条
detailed_translations.english: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

sentences.english: He unzipped his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 他拉开夹克衫的拉链。

sentences.english: The bitter wind cut through his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 刺骨的冷风吹透了他的夹克衫。

sentences.english: When I grew out of my jacket,I gave it to my little brother.
sentences.chinese: 我长得穿不下我的夹克衫了，便把它给我弟弟穿。

detailed_translations.english: a short light coat

sentences.english: strawberry jam
sentences.chinese: 草莓酱

sentences.english: a jam sandwich
sentences.chinese: 果酱三明治

sentences.english: jam jars
sentences.chinese: 果酱罐

detailed_translations.english: a thick sweet substance made from boiled fruit and sugar, eaten especially on bread

detailed_translations.chinese: 使堵塞；挤进，使塞满；混杂；压碎
detailed_translations.english: if a lot of people or vehicles jam a place, they fill it so that it is difficult to move

sentences.english: He owns a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 他拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷射，喷嘴；喷气式飞机；黑玉
detailed_translations.english: a fast plane with a jet engine
if a liquid or gas jets out from somewhere, it comes quickly out of a small hole

sentences.english: I go jogging every morning.
sentences.chinese: 我每天早晨都去慢跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 慢跑；轻推；蹒跚行进；使颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to run slowly and steadily, especially as a way of exercising
a slow steady run, especially done as a way of exercising

name: joke
trans: n .笑话 玩笑v. 和... 开玩笑

sentences.english: I couldn’t go out with someone for a joke, could you?
sentences.chinese: 我可不能拿谈恋爱当儿戏，对不对？

sentences.english: I never joke about money.
sentences.chinese: 我从不拿钱开玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to make people laugh, especially a funny story or trick
to say things that are intended to be funny and that you do not really mean

sentences.english: the friends they made on the journey
sentences.chinese: 他们在旅途中交下的朋友

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance
an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance

name: joy
trans: n .欢乐，喜悦，  乐事，  乐趣

sentences.english: the look of joy on her face
sentences.chinese: 她脸上的喜悦表情

sentences.english: The garden was his pride and joy.
sentences.chinese: 这座花园是他的骄傲和乐趣所在。

detailed_translations.english: great happiness and pleasure

sentences.english: You should never judge a person by their looks.
sentences.chinese: 决不要以貌取人。

sentences.english: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.english: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.chinese: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.english: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.chinese: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.english: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.english: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.chinese: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.english: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.chinese: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.english: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.chinese: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.english: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.english: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.english: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.chinese: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

detailed_translations.english: to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them
the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

sentences.english: a juicy lemon
sentences.chinese: 多汁的柠檬

detailed_translations.chinese: 多汁的；利润多的；生动的
detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of juice

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

sentences.english: He kicked the door hard.
sentences.chinese: 他用力踢门。

sentences.english: The boys were kicking a ball around in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在院子里踢球。

sentences.english: She gave him a kick on the shin.
sentences.chinese: 她朝他的小腿踢了一脚。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth with your foot
a movement with the foot or the leg, usually to hit sth with the foot

sentences.english: By comparison, one kilogram of tomatoes requires 160 litres of water.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，生产一公斤的番茄需要160升水。

sentences.english: For example, the kilogram scale allows you to assign a number to an object indicating its weight based upon standardized displacements of measuring instruments.
sentences.chinese: 例如，千克尺度允许您给一个物体分配数字，根据测量仪器的标准化的偏移量指示该物体的重量。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 1,000 grams

sentences.english: On 2 December Henry VI was crowned king (= made the king at an official ceremony ).
sentences.chinese: 12月2日，亨利六世加冕为王。

detailed_translations.english: a man who rules a country because he is from a royal family

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的，最重要的，最大的

sentences.english: Sam went into the kitchen to make a pot of tea.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆走进厨房去沏一壶茶。

sentences.english: She is in the kitchen making a meal.
sentences.chinese: 她在厨房里做饭。

detailed_translations.english: the room where you prepare and cook food

name: knock
trans: v. 敲， 敲打， 敲击

sentences.english: I knocked and knocked but nobody answered.
sentences.chinese: 我把门敲了又敲，但无人回应。

sentences.english: He got a nasty knock on the head.
sentences.chinese: 他头部遭到重重一击。

detailed_translations.english: to hit a door or window with your closed hand to attract the attention of the people inside
a sharp blow from sth hard

name: labor
trans: n . 劳动，工作， 劳工；vi. 劳动，努力

sentences.english: I should assign you your share of labor, and compel you to accomplish it.
sentences.chinese: 我要把属于你的那份劳动分配给你，并且强迫你完成它。

sentences.english: For the happiness of human labor, this is how magnificent cause, this goal is how great!
sentences.chinese: 为人类的幸福而劳动，这是多么壮丽的事业，这个目标有多么伟大！

sentences.english: However, after years of labor in their chosen field, they begin to hate their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们在选择的领域工作了几年后，便开始痛恨自己的工作。

name: largely
trans: adv.主要地， 大量地，很大程度上

sentences.english: The state of Nevada is largely desert.
sentences.chinese: 内华达州大部分是沙漠。

sentences.english: It had been a tiring day, largely because of all the tedious waiting.
sentences.chinese: 那一天真累人，主要是因为等得无聊。

detailed_translations.english: mostly or mainly

name: lawful
trans: adj. 合法的， 法定的， 法律许可的

sentences.english: It is not lawful to kill or injure a pet animal.
sentences.chinese: 杀死或伤害宠物是犯法的。

sentences.english: a lawful arrest
sentences.chinese: 依法逮捕

sentences.english: his lawful wife
sentences.chinese: 他的合法妻子

detailed_translations.chinese: 合法的；法定的；法律许可的
detailed_translations.english: allowed or recognized by law

sentences.english: the laziest boy in the class
sentences.chinese: 班上最懒的男孩

sentences.english: He felt too lazy to get out of bed.
sentences.chinese: 他懒得都不想起床。

detailed_translations.english: not liking work and physical activity, or not making any effort to do anything

sentences.english: the largest ever gathering of world leaders
sentences.chinese: 全世界领导人史无前例的大聚会

detailed_translations.english: the person who directs or controls a group, organization, country etc

name: lecture
trans: n . 演讲，讲稿；vt . 演讲，训诫，说教vi.讲演

sentences.english: He regularly gives lectures on modern French literature.
sentences.chinese: 他经常讲授法国现代文学课程。

sentences.english: He lectures on European art at Manchester University.
sentences.chinese: 他在曼彻斯特大学讲授欧洲艺术。

detailed_translations.english: a long talk on a particular subject that someone gives to a group of people, especially to students in a university
to talk to a group of people on a particular subject, especially to students in a university

name: leftover
trans: n .剩余物，残留物，剩菜； adj.剩余的

sentences.english: Give the leftovers to the dog.
sentences.chinese: 把吃剩的饭菜喂狗。

sentences.english: The headmaster was a leftover from the Victorian era.
sentences.chinese: 校长是维多利亚时代的遗老

sentences.english: leftover vegetables
sentences.chinese: 吃剩的蔬菜

detailed_translations.english: food that has not been eaten at the end of a meal
remaining after all the rest has been used, taken, or eaten

sentences.english: a young boy with skinny legs
sentences.chinese: 双腿干瘦的小男孩

sentences.english: She fell and broke her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔断了腿。

detailed_translations.english: one of the long parts of your body that your feet are joined to, or a similar part on an animal or insect

sentences.english: Can you lengthen this skirt for me?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能帮我把这条裙子改长？

sentences.english: The days lengthened as summer approached.
sentences.chinese: 随着夏天来临，白天变长了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something longer or to become longer

sentences.english: Are you calling me a liar?
sentences.chinese: 你是说我在撒谎？

detailed_translations.english: someone who deliberately says things which are not true

sentences.english: She became a lifelong friend of ours.
sentences.chinese: 她成了我们一辈子的朋友。

sentences.english: David finally realized his lifelong ambition.
sentences.chinese: 戴维终于实现了他毕生的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: continuing or existing all through your life

sentences.english: It’s the sort of opportunity you see only once in a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 这种机会你一辈子也只能碰到一次。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time during which someone is alive or something exists

name: lift
trans: n . 电梯，起重机；vt .升高，提高，举起；vi.升起

sentences.english: Sophie lifted the phone before the second ring.
sentences.chinese: 铃响了一下苏菲就接起了电话。

sentences.english: He lifted the lid on the pot of soup.
sentences.chinese: 他揭开汤锅的盖子。

sentences.english: The lumber was lifted by crane and dropped into the truck.
sentences.chinese: 木材由起重机搬运到卡车上。

sentences.english: They took the lift down to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘电梯去楼下的酒吧。

sentences.english: It’s on the 3rd floor. Let’s use the lift.
sentences.chinese: 在三楼，我们乘电梯上去吧。

detailed_translations.english: to move something or someone upwards into the air
a machine that you can ride in, that moves up and down between the floors in a tall building

name: limit
trans: n .界限， 限度， 限制；vt . 限制， 限定

sentences.english: a 55 mph speed limit
sentences.chinese: 55英里的时速限制

sentences.english: The public is not allowed within a 2-mile limit of the missile site.
sentences.chinese: 众不得进入导弹发射场两英里范围内。

detailed_translations.english: the greatest or least amount, number, speed etc that is allowed

name: line

sentences.english: I remember the moment when I first saw him after the operation.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得手术后第一次见到他的那一刻。

sentences.english: Quinn always seems to be in the right place at the crucial moment.
sentences.chinese: 奎因似乎总能在关键时刻把握时机。

sentences.english: I just this moment (= only a very short time ago ) arrived and already Dan wants to know when I’m leaving.
sentences.chinese: 我才刚到，丹就想知道我什么时候走。

sentences.english: At this moment in time it would be inappropriate to comment on the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这个时候恐怕不宜对局势作出评论。

sentences.english: It was quiet for a moment, then Rae spoke.
sentences.chinese: 沉寂了片刻，然后雷开始说话了。

detailed_translations.english: a particular point in time

name: motivate
trans: v.激发 ；<衍生词> motivation   n .动机

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: motorcycle
trans: n .摩托车，机车；<衍生词> motorcycling  v. 骑摩托车 ；motorcyclist  n .乘机车者

sentences.english: You'd better encash your motorcycle at once.
sentences.chinese: 你最好马上卖掉摩托车换成现款。

sentences.english: She can ride a motorcycle， to say nothing of a bicycle.
sentences.chinese: 她摩托车都会骑， 自行车更不在话下了。

sentences.english: He runs behind a motorcycle for half an hour every morning.
sentences.chinese: 他每天早晨跟在摩托车后面跑半个小时。

detailed_translations.english: a fast two-wheeled vehicle with an engine

sentences.english: the highest mountain in Austria
sentences.chinese: 奥地利最高的山

sentences.english: the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 落基山脉

sentences.english: a steep mountain road
sentences.chinese: 陡峭的山路

sentences.english: magnificent mountain ranges
sentences.chinese: 雄伟的山脉

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山峰

sentences.english: a mountain rescue team
sentences.chinese: 山地营救队

sentences.english: She was the first British woman to climb the mountain .
sentences.chinese: 她是攀登这座山峰的第一位英国女子。

detailed_translations.english: a very high hill

sentences.english: They daubed mud all over themselves.
sentences.chinese: 他们用泥涂满全身。

sentences.english: I dirty my trousers when I step on the mud.
sentences.chinese: 我一脚擩在烂泥里， 把裤子弄脏了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 泥；诽谤的话；无价值的东西
detailed_translations.english: wet earth that has become soft and sticky

name: multiple
trans: adj. 多样的， 多重的； n .倍数，若干

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

sentences.english: a musical version of the fairy tale ‘Cinderella’
sentences.chinese: 童话故事《灰姑娘》的音乐剧版

sentences.english: When he began his musical career, King played only for black audiences.
sentences.chinese: 金在音乐事业的开始阶段只为黑人观众演奏。

detailed_translations.english: relating to music or consisting of music

sentences.english: a talented young musician
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的年轻音乐家

detailed_translations.english: a person who plays a musical instrument or writes music, especially as a job

name: narrow
trans: n . 海峡， 隘路； adj.狭窄的；vi. 变窄；vt .使变狭窄

sentences.english: The stairs were very narrow.
sentences.chinese: 楼梯非常狭窄。

sentences.english: a long, narrow band of cloud
sentences.chinese: 窄长的云带

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a small distance from one side to the other, especially in relation to the length

name: natural
trans: adj. 自然的，天赋的；<衍生词>  nat urally adv. 自然地

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

sentences.english: You’re a very naughty boy! Look what you’ve done!
sentences.chinese: 你真是个淘气鬼！瞧你干了些什么！

detailed_translations.english: a naughty child does not obey adults and behaves badly

name: nearby
trans: adj. 附近的，邻近的； adv.在附近

sentences.english: Lucy was staying in the nearby town of Hamilton.
sentences.chinese: 露西当时住在附近的汉密尔顿镇。

sentences.english: He might easily have been seen by someone who lived nearby.
sentences.chinese: 他可能很容易被住在附近的人看到。

sentences.english: The helicopter crashed to earth nearby.
sentences.chinese: 直升机坠毁在附近的地面上。

detailed_translations.english: not far away
a short distance from sb/sth; not far away

sentences.english: It took nearly two hours to get here.
sentences.chinese: 到这里花了将近两小时。

sentences.english: Michelle’s nearly twenty.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔年近二十。

sentences.english: Is the job nearly finished?
sentences.chinese: 这工作快干完了吗？

sentences.english: Louise is nearly as tall as her mother.
sentences.chinese: 路易丝差不多和她母亲一样高。

sentences.english: I nearly always go home for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我几乎总是回家吃午饭。

sentences.english: He very nearly died.
sentences.chinese: 他差点送命。

detailed_translations.english: almost, but not quite or not completely

sentences.english: Mike rubbed the back of his neck.
sentences.chinese: 迈克揉了揉后颈。

sentences.english: You have a lot of tension in your neck muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你的颈部肌肉很紧张。

sentences.english: He patted his horse’s neck.
sentences.chinese: 他拍了拍马脖子。

sentences.english: She had a mass of golden hair, which she wore in a coil at the nape  of her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她有一头金发，盘在脖子后面。

sentences.english: The dog picked up the puppy and carried it by the scruff of the neck into the house.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗叼住小狗的后颈，把它叼进了屋子。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body that joins your head to your shoulders, or the same part of an animal or bird

name: negative
trans: n .否定，  负数 ；adj.否定的， 消极的

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: neglect
trans: vt . 忽视，疏忽， 漏做； n .忽视，疏忽， 漏做

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: negotiate
trans: v. 与某人商议，谈判 ；<衍生词> negotiation n . 商议，谈判； negotiator n .谈判代表

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: neighbor
trans: n .邻居，邻国；<衍生词>  neighborhood n . 附近，邻近

sentences.english: I parked my baby at the neighbor's house.
sentences.chinese: 我把小孩寄放在邻居家里。

sentences.english: It means you love Him with all your heart, and you love your neighbor as yourself.
sentences.chinese: 它意味着你全心全意的爱上帝并且像爱自己那样爱邻居。

sentences.english: See, if you break any one of those commandments, you do not love your neighbor as yourself.
sentences.chinese: 看，如果你违反了其中任何一条戒律，你就没能像爱自己那样爱邻居。

name: neither
trans: adj.&pron . 两者都不； conj.既不... 又不 也不

sentences.english: Neither Oleg’s mother nor his father spoke English.
sentences.chinese: 奥列格的父母都不会说英语。

sentences.english: The equipment is neither accurate nor safe.
sentences.chinese: 这台设备既不精确，也不安全。

detailed_translations.english: used when mentioning two things that are not true or possible
used to show that a negative statement is also true about another person or thing

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

name: note
trans: n . 笔记，短信；vt . 注意，记录

sentences.english: Dave made a note of her address and phone number.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫记下了她的地址和电话号码。

sentences.english: I was going to write Kathy a note, but I decided to call her instead.
sentences.chinese: 我原来准备给凯茜写个便条，但又决定还是打电话给她。

sentences.english: The notes are at the back of the book.
sentences.chinese: 注解在书末。

detailed_translations.english: something that you write down to remind you of something

sentences.english: The cream contains vitamin A to nourish the skin.
sentences.chinese: 这种护肤霜含有滋养肌肤的维生素A。

sentences.english: a well nourished baby
sentences.chinese: 营养良好的婴儿

detailed_translations.english: to give a person or other living thing the food and other substances they need in order to live, grow, and stay healthy

sentences.english: The cold had numbed her fingers.
sentences.chinese: 她的手指冻僵了。

sentences.english: the numbing effect of the drug
sentences.chinese: 那种药物的麻醉效果

detailed_translations.chinese: 使麻木；使发愣；使失去感觉
detailed_translations.english: to make someone unable to feel pain or feel things they are touching
a part of your body that is numb is unable to feel anything, for example because you are very cold

sentences.english: They wrote various numbers on a large sheet of paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一张大纸上写下了很多不同的数字。

sentences.english: Add all the numbers together.
sentences.chinese: 把所有数字加起来。

sentences.english: Answer question number 4.
sentences.chinese: 回答第4题。

detailed_translations.english: a word or sign that represents an amount or a quantity

name: object
trans: n .  目标，  对象；vi.反对，抗议；vt .提出...来反对

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: obscure
trans: adj. 暗的，朦胧的；vt .使暗，使不明显

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: observant
trans: adj. 善于观察的，机警的，严格遵守的

sentences.english: a quiet and observant person
sentences.chinese: 一个寡言而机敏的人

sentences.english: Supervisors are trained to be observant.
sentences.chinese: 主管被训练得敏锐机警。

sentences.english: the writer’s observant eye for detail
sentences.chinese: 这位作家善于捕捉细节的敏锐目光

detailed_translations.chinese: 善于观察的；机警的；严格遵守的
detailed_translations.english: good or quick at noticing things

sentences.english: We’re obviously going to need more help.
sentences.chinese: 显然我们将需要更多的帮助。

sentences.english: Your research has obviously been very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 你的研究工作显然做得很透彻。

sentences.english: Obviously, this is going to take some time.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，这要花点时间。

sentences.english: Cost is obviously important.
sentences.chinese: 费用当然很重要。

sentences.english: She frowned and was obviously puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 她皱起眉头，显然感到不解。

detailed_translations.english: used to mean that a fact can easily be noticed or understood

name: occasion
trans: n . 场合， 时机，机会；<衍生词> occasionally adv.有时候，偶而

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

name: occupy
trans: vt . 占用，  占领 ，  占据

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

sentences.english: She stood on the beach, gazing at the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 她站在海滩上，凝视着大海。

sentences.english: I like to swim in the ocean when it’s warm enough.
sentences.chinese: 海水足够暖的时候，我喜欢在海里游泳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洋， 海洋； 许多， 大量
detailed_translations.english: the great mass of salt water that covers most of the Earth’s surface

name: official
trans: n . 官员，公务员； adj.职务上的 ， 官方的，正式的

sentences.english: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
sentences.chinese: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查

sentences.english: the official policy on education
sentences.chinese: 官方的教育政策

sentences.english: official statistics about illegal drug use
sentences.chinese: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据

sentences.english: You will have to get official permission first.
sentences.chinese: 你必须先得到正式许可。

sentences.english: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
sentences.chinese: 任命书终于来了，这样一切都名正言顺了。

detailed_translations.english: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government

detailed_translations.chinese: 官员， 行政人员， 高级人员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization

sentences.english: their ongoing search for a new director
sentences.chinese: 他们仍在寻找一个新主任

sentences.english: ongoing negotiations
sentences.chinese: 还在进行的谈判

sentences.english: The discussions are still ongoing.
sentences.chinese: 讨论仍在继续。

detailed_translations.english: continuing, or continuing to develop

sentences.english: She watched him walk onto the platform.
sentences.chinese: 她看着他走上站台。

sentences.english: Don’t jump onto (= into ) the bus while it’s moving.
sentences.chinese: 别在公共汽车开动时跳上车。

sentences.english: Pour the syrup on to the egg mixture.
sentences.chinese: 把糖浆倒进鸡蛋混合料中。

sentences.english: The car rolled over onto its side.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车侧翻过来了。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that someone or something moves to a position on a surface, area, or object

name: operate
trans: v. 操作，运转，起作用，动手术；<衍生词> operator ；n . 操作员，经营者

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

name: option
trans: n . 选项，选择权；<衍生词> optional adj.可选择的， 随意的

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

name: ordinary
trans: adj. 平常的，普通的，平凡的

sentences.english: It’s just an ordinary camera.
sentences.chinese: 这只是普通的相机。

sentences.english: The book is about ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 这本书描写的是普通人。

sentences.english: Art should be part of ordinary life.
sentences.chinese: 艺术应该是日常生活的一部分。

sentences.english: It is good because it is written in friendly, ordinary language.
sentences.chinese: 它很不错，因为它是用平易近人的日常语言写的。

detailed_translations.english: average, common, or usual, not different or special

sentences.english: Organic farming is better for the environment.
sentences.chinese: 有机耕作对环境更有利。

sentences.english: organic gardening
sentences.chinese: 有机园艺

detailed_translations.english: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: original
trans: adj. 最初的，原始的； n . 原物，原作；<衍生词>  originally adv. 最初，原先

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

name: outdoor
trans: adj. 室外的， 户外的，野外的

trans: vt . 战胜，克服，胜过，征服；vi.得胜

sentences.chinese: 假如你的行李过重了， 你得付额外的运费。

sentences.english: Why are so many of us overweight?

The Pacific or the Pacific Ocean is a very large sea to the west of North and South America, and to the east of Asia and Australia

name: pack
trans: n .背包， 包装；vt . 包装，捆扎；vi. 包装货物

trans: n . 页 ；vt .标明... 的页；vi.翻书页

name: paint

sentences.chinese: 除了餐厅和野餐区，我们还为游客提供免费停车位。

sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯没有受到邀请太遗憾了。

sentences.chinese: 这是一家大航空公司，拥有庞大的机群。

sentences.chinese: 四人玩的游戏

sentences.chinese: 多汁的成熟李子

detailed_translations.chinese: 人所希望的；有利的；上等的

sentences.english: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
sentences.chinese: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家

sentences.english: a British Labour politician
sentences.chinese: 英国工党政治家

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

sentences.english: They have a nice pool in their backyard.
sentences.chinese: 他们后院有个漂亮的游泳池。

sentences.english: a shallow pool suitable for children
sentences.chinese: 适合儿童的浅水池

sentences.english: pools of water with tiny fish in them
sentences.chinese: 有小鱼的一个个水池

detailed_translations.english: a hole or container that has been specially made and filled with water so that people can swim or play in it

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: possess
trans: vt . 占有，拥有，持有， 支配；<衍生词>  possession n .拥有，  占有，所有，领地，财产

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

sentences.english: a fence post
sentences.chinese: 篱笆桩

sentences.english: The exam results were posted on the bulletin board yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩昨天在布告板上贴出来了。

detailed_translations.english: a strong upright piece of wood, metal etc that is fixed into the ground, especially to support something
to put up a public notice about something on a wall or notice board

sentences.english: Marie stood at the sink, peeling potatoes (= cutting off the skin ) .
sentences.chinese: 玛丽站在洗涤槽边削土豆皮。

detailed_translations.chinese: [作物] 土豆，[作物] 马铃薯
detailed_translations.english: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or pale yellow skin, that grows under the ground

name: power
trans: n . 能力，力量，权力；vt .使...有力量，供以动力

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

name: practical
trans: adj.实际的， 实践的， 实用的

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: predict
trans: v.预知，预言，预报；<衍生词> predictor n .预言者，预报器

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: present
trans: n .赠品，礼物，现在； adj.现在的，  出席的，  当面的；vt .赠送，提出，呈现

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

sentences.english: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.english: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.chinese: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.english: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

sentences.english: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
imaginary or not real - used especially by children

sentences.english: a pretty little girl
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的小姑娘

sentences.english: Maria looks much prettier with her hair cut short.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚把头发剪短好看多了。

detailed_translations.english: a woman or child who is pretty has a nice attractive face

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

sentences.english: Princess Anne
sentences.chinese: 安妮公主

sentences.english: the Princess of Wales
sentences.chinese: 威尔士王妃

detailed_translations.english: a close female relation of a king and queen, especially a daughter

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: prize
trans: n .奖赏，奖金，奖品； adj.得奖的

sentences.english: In this month’s competition you could win a prize worth £3,000.
sentences.chinese: 在本月的竞赛中您可以赢得价值3,000英镑的奖品。

sentences.english: The first prize has gone to Dr John Gentle.
sentences.chinese: 获得一等奖的是约翰·金特尔博士。

sentences.english: The prizes are awarded (= given ) every year to students who have shown original thinking in their work.
sentences.chinese: 这些奖项每年颁发给在学习中表现出创造性思维的学生。

sentences.english: The total prize money was £30,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖金总额为3万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: something that is given to someone who is successful in a competition, race, game of chance etc
to think that someone or something is very important or valuable
good enough to win a prize or having won a prize

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

name: proceed
trans: vi.进行，继续下去， 发生

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

sentences.english: That model won't go into production before late 2007.
sentences.chinese: 那种型号要到2007年底才会投入生产。

sentences.english: a drop in oil and gas production
sentences.chinese: 石油和天然气产量的下降

detailed_translations.english: the process of making or growing things to be sold, especially in large quantities

name: productive
trans: adj.生产性的， 生产的， 能产的， 多产的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

name: profession
trans: n .职业， 专业， 宣布

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

name: professional
trans: n . 自由职业者， 专业人员，职业运动员； adj. 专业的，职业的

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

sentences.chinese: 教授在课堂上即兴创作了一首诗。

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授严厉批评了我的粗心错误。

sentences.english: We were laughing about that absent-minded professor.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在笑那个心不在焉的教授。

name: profit
trans: n .利润，益处，得益；vi.得益，利用；vt .有益于，有利于

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

sentences.english: the US space program
sentences.chinese: 美国太空计划

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions which are designed to achieve something important

name: promise
trans: vt .允诺，答应； n .允诺，答应，许诺

sentences.chinese: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

sentences.english: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

name: promote
trans: vt .促进， 发扬，提升，提拔，晋升为；<衍生词> promotion  n .促进， 发扬，提升，提拔，晋升

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: prompt
trans: v. 提示，鼓励，促进，激起，导致；  adj. 敏捷的，迅速的，立刻的，及时的

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time

name: proper
trans: adj.适当的，正确的，  正当的

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

name: proud
trans: adj. 自豪的，得意的，骄傲的，妄自尊大的；<衍生词> proudly  adv.骄傲地

sentences.english: a proud man who would not admit his mistakes
sentences.chinese: 自以为是、不愿认错的男子

sentences.english: Seth was the proud owner of a new sports car.
sentences.chinese: 赛思因为有了新跑车而扬扬得意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骄傲的；自负的〔含贬义〕；自豪的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are more important, skilful etc than you really are – used to show disapproval

name: publish
trans: v. 出版，刊印；vt .公布， 发表

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

sentences.english: Mom! Davey’s pulling my hair!
sentences.chinese: 妈妈! 戴维拽我的头发！

sentences.english: He gave her a sharp pull forward.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地把她往前一拉。

detailed_translations.english: to use your hands to make something or someone move towards you or in the direction that your hands are moving
an act of using force to move something towards you or in the same direction that you are moving

sentences.english: water/air/beer etc pump (=for moving water, air etc)
sentences.chinese: 抽水机/抽气机/啤酒泵等

sentences.english: It's not enough to get rid of raw sewage by pumping it out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 仅用水泵将未经处理的污水排入海中是不够的。

sentences.english: The money raised will be used to dig bore holes to pump water into the dried-up lake.
sentences.chinese: 筹到的钱款将用来挖井眼，再将水抽入干涸的湖中。

detailed_translations.english: a machine for forcing liquid or gas into or out of something
to make liquid or gas move in a particular direction, using a pump

name: purchase
trans: vt . 买，购买； n .买，购买

sentences.english: She paid for her purchases and left.
sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.english: I enclose my receipt as proof of purchase .
sentences.chinese: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

sentences.english: She made two purchases from my stall.
sentences.chinese: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

sentences.english: You can purchase insurance online.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在网上买保险。

detailed_translations.english: something you buy, or the act of buying it
to buy something

name: purpose
trans: n . 目的， 意图， 用途；vt .打算，企图， 决心

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

sentences.english: It didn’t move, so she pushed harder.
sentences.chinese: 它一动不动，因此她加力去推。

sentences.english: I promised to push him on the swings for as long as he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 我答应他想在秋千上荡多久我就推多久。

sentences.english: shoppers pushing their grocery carts
sentences.chinese: 推着购物车的购物者

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc
to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc

name: puzzle
trans: n .难题，谜；v. 使迷惑，使为难，迷惑不解

sentences.english: The meaning of the poem has always been a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。

sentences.english: He thought he had solved the puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他已经解开了那个谜。

sentences.english: What puzzles me is why his books are so popular.
sentences.chinese: 令我不解的是，他的书为什么如此受欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: something that is difficult to understand or explain
