name: qualify
trans: v. 使具有资格，证明合格， 限制修饰

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

sentences.english: Queen Elizabeth
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白女王

sentences.english: the future queen
sentences.chinese: 未来的王后

sentences.english: the queen of diamonds
sentences.chinese: 方块Q，方块王后

detailed_translations.english: the female ruler of a country

sentences.english: We need to get this finished as quickly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须尽快完成此事。

sentences.english: Kids grow up so quickly these days.
sentences.chinese: 现在的孩子长得真快啊。

detailed_translations.english: fast

sentences.english: I’m sorry. That’s quite impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉，那是完全不可能的。

sentences.english: I felt quite bitter about it at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我对此感到相当痛苦。

sentences.english: Well, actually it requires quite a bit of work and research.
sentences.chinese: 呃，实际上这需要相当多的工作和研究。

sentences.english: I can see it quite clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我能清清楚楚地看见它。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: race
trans: n .种族，赛跑；vi.赛跑，疾走；vt . 与...赛跑

sentences.english: The race is on to develop more environmentally friendly forms of energy.
sentences.chinese: 人们正在竞相开发更环保的能源形式。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which one group of people tries to obtain or achieve something before another group does

name: radio
trans: n . 收音机； 无线电广播设备

sentences.english: We’ve lost radio contact with the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们和这架飞机失去了无线电联络。

sentences.english: I sat down and turned on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 我坐下来打开收音机。

detailed_translations.english: when messages are sent or received in this way

sentences.english: a railway company
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司

detailed_translations.english: a system of tracks along which trains run, or a system of trains

sentences.english: a night of wind and rain
sentences.chinese: 风雨交加的夜晚

sentences.english: There will be heavy rain in most parts of the country.
sentences.chinese: 全国大部分地区将有大雨。

sentences.english: Outside it was still raining.
sentences.chinese: 外面仍在下雨。

detailed_translations.english: water that falls in small drops from clouds in the sky
if it rains, drops of water fall from clouds in the sky

sentences.english: a cold rainy day in October
sentences.chinese: 十月里一个寒冷的雨天

sentences.english: I hate rainy weather .
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌雨天。

sentences.english: the rainy season
sentences.chinese: 雨季

detailed_translations.english: a rainy period of time is one when it rains a lot

name: randomly
trans: adv. 随便地， 未加计划地

sentences.english: They throw out all of these behaviors randomly.
sentences.chinese: 它们的这些行为都是随机的。

sentences.english: It mimics a memory leak by randomly placing some of these arrays (~20% of them) into a list.
sentences.chinese: 它通过随机将这些数组的一部分（大约 20%）放入一个列表来模拟内存泄漏。

name: range
trans: vt .排列， 归类于，使并列；vi.平行，延伸， 漫游

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

name: rapid
trans: adj.迅速的，飞快的； n . 急流 ；<衍生词> rapidly adv.迅速地

sentences.english: The patient made a rapid recovery.
sentences.chinese: 病人迅速康复。

sentences.english: a period of rapid decline
sentences.chinese: 迅速衰退期

sentences.english: He fired three times in rapid succession (= one after another ) .
sentences.chinese: 他接连开了三枪。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time

name: rare
trans: adj.稀罕的， 杰出的； adv.非常；<衍生词>  rarely adv.很少地， 罕有地

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

sentences.english: This was demonstrated in a laboratory experiment with rats.
sentences.chinese: 这点通过在实验室中用老鼠做试验得到证明。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that looks like a large mouse with a long tail

name: rather
trans: adv. 宁愿， 宁可，更合适

sentences.english: I grew up in rather unusual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我在相当不寻常的环境中长大。

sentences.english: I'm afraid it's a rather long story.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕这是个相当长的故事。

sentences.english: I’d rather have a quiet night in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿晚上安安静静地看看电视。

detailed_translations.english: fairly or to some degree

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

sentences.english: Professor Dippet told him that he was too young at eighteen, but invited him to reapply in a few years, if he still wished to teach.
sentences.chinese: 迪佩特教授说他才十八岁，太年轻了，但欢迎他过两年再来申请，如果到那时他还想教书的话。

sentences.english: The new guidelines also mandate that products include directions to reapply regularly and prohibit brands from claiming on their labels that their sunscreens are sweat proof or waterproof.
sentences.chinese: 新准则还强制规定，产品要定期进行方向再申请，并禁止在其标签上声称，其防晒霜是防汗或防水的。

sentences.english: He has recently been promoted to Assistant Manager.
sentences.chinese: 他最近晋升为经理助理。

sentences.english: a recently published biography
sentences.chinese: 一部最近出版的传记

sentences.english: Jerry lived in Cairo until quite recently .
sentences.chinese: 直至不久之前杰里一直住在开罗。

sentences.english: More recently, he’s appeared in a number of British films.
sentences.chinese: 最近，他出演了多部英国电影。

detailed_translations.english: not long ago

name: recommend
trans: vt .推荐，介绍，劝告；<衍生词>   recommendation n .推荐，介绍，建议

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: recycle
trans: v.使再循环，反复应用； n .再循环，再生，重复利用

sentences.english: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

detailed_translations.english: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new

name: refer
trans: vt .提交 谈及 归诸于 指点把...提交 使求助于vi.提到 涉及 查阅 咨询

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: reference
trans: n .提及， 涉及，参考，介绍信

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

sentences.english: My refrigerator suddenly started kicking up yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我的冰箱昨晚突然出了故障。

sentences.english: The minute Tom came home he beelined for the refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆一回到家就直奔冰箱而来。

sentences.english: Letters have been pouring into the office complaining about this kind of refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 办公室连续收到大批信件抱怨这种电冰箱。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment, shaped like a cupboard, used for keeping food and drink cool

sentences.english: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
sentences.chinese: 她叫他走，但他不肯。

sentences.english: When he offered all that money, I could hardly refuse (= could not refuse ) , could I?
sentences.chinese: 他愿意给那么多钱，我怎么可能拒绝呢？

sentences.english: The town made a weekly collection of refuse.
sentences.chinese: 该镇每周收一次垃圾。

detailed_translations.english: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
waste material that has been thrown away

name: regard
trans: n . 关心， 注意，尊敬，致意， 问候；vt .看待，  当作，重视，尊敬

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

detailed_translations.english: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

name: regret
trans: n .遗憾，悔恨；vt . 为...感到遗憾，后悔，懊悔；vi.感到抱歉

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: regular
trans: adj.规则的，有秩序的，经常的， 定期的；<衍生词> regularly adv.有规律地，有规则地，整齐地，  匀称

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

sentences.english: They sent me a rejection letter.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我发了一封回绝信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of not accepting, believing in, or agreeing with something

name: relative
trans: n .亲戚； adj.有关系的，相对的， 比较而言的；<衍生词> relatively  相关地

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: release
trans: n .释放，豁免；vt .释放，解放，免除， 发表

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

sentences.english: the country’s heavy reliance on trade
sentences.chinese: 该国对贸易的严重依赖

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is dependent on someone or something else

name: relief
trans: n . 救济，减轻，解除，安慰， 浮雕

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

name: rely
trans: v.依赖，依靠，信赖，信任，依赖于

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.chinese: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

name: remark
trans: n .备注，评论， 注释；vt .评论， 注意 ，谈及；vi.谈论

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: remote
trans: adj.遥远的，偏僻的， 细微的

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: renew
trans: vt .使更新，使恢复；vi.更新 重新开始

sentences.english: The window frames need to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 窗框需要换新的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

name: repair
trans: n .修理，修补；vt .修理，修补， 纠正

sentences.english: Dad was up the ladder, repairing the roof.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸在梯子上修补屋顶。

sentences.english: Where can I get my shoes repaired ?
sentences.chinese: 哪儿能修补鞋子？

sentences.english: The church tower is in need of repair.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的塔楼需要修缮。

detailed_translations.english: to fix something that is damaged, broken, split, or not working properly
something that you do to fix a thing that is damaged, broken, or not working

name: represent
trans: vt .代表，声称， 象征 ；vi.提出异议

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: request
trans: vt .请求，要求； n .请求，要求

sentences.english: They have made an urgent request for international aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们紧急请求国际援助。

sentences.english: To request more information, please call our toll free number.
sentences.chinese: 欲知详情，请拨打我们的免费电话。

detailed_translations.english: a polite or formal demand for something
to ask for something in a polite or formal way

name: research
trans: n .研究，调查；vi.研究，调查 ；<衍生词>  researcher.n .研究员

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: resolve
trans: n . 决心；v. 决心， 决定

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: respect
trans: n .尊敬，敬重，敬意；vt .尊敬，尊重；<衍生词>  respectable ，adj.可敬的，有名望的，值得尊敬的

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.english: The retail value would be around $500.
sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else
to be sold for a particular price in a shop

name: retirement
trans: n .退休，  引退，撤退 ；<衍生词> retire v.退休

sentences.english: She took early retirement (= retired at an earlier age than usual ) last year.
sentences.chinese: 她去年提前退休了。

sentences.english: Dad’s approaching retirement age .
sentences.chinese: 爸爸快到退休年龄了。

detailed_translations.english: when you stop working, usually because of your age

name: return
trans: n . 回来，返回 ；adj.返回的， 回程的；v. 回返， 归还

sentences.english: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
sentences.chinese: 过了45分钟她才回来。

sentences.english: Alison decided to return home.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森决定回家。

sentences.english: He left his country, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了祖国，一去不复返。

detailed_translations.english: to go or come back to a place where you were before
the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

sentences.english: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.english: complicated dance rhythms
sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.english: the body’s natural rhythms
sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

detailed_translations.english: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

sentences.english: a tasty sauce served with rice or pasta
sentences.chinese: 配米饭或意面的美味酱汁

sentences.english: a plate of brown rice
sentences.chinese: 一盘糙米饭

sentences.english: Serve with plain boiled rice .
sentences.chinese: 配白米饭一起上桌。

sentences.english: a few grains of rice
sentences.chinese: 几粒大米

detailed_translations.english: a food that consists of small white or brown grains that you boil in water until they become soft enough to eat

name: rich
trans: adj. 富的，有钱的， 富饶的，丰富的

sentences.english: Rich mineral deposits have been found in the sea bed.
sentences.chinese: 海底发现有丰富的矿床。

sentences.english: Red meat is a rich source of iron.
sentences.chinese: 红肉含有大量铁质。

sentences.english: This is a system in which the rich are taken care of and the poor are left to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 这是个富人受关照，而穷人遭罪的制度。

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Rich)人名；(丹)里克；(捷)里赫；(英、西)里奇；(葡、法)里什
detailed_translations.english: The rich are rich people

sentences.english: the ridicule of his peers
sentences.chinese: 他同龄人的奚落

sentences.english: The government’s proposals were held up to ridicule (= suffered ridicule ) by opposition ministers.
sentences.chinese: 政府的提案遭到反对党部长们的嘲笑。

sentences.english: He had become an object of ridicule among the other teachers.
sentences.chinese: 他成了其他教师嘲笑的对象。

detailed_translations.english: unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make someone or something seem stupid
to laugh at a person, idea etc and say that they are stupid

name: rise
trans: n .上升，增加， 发生，  出现；vi.升起，起身，增长，上升

sentences.english: The police seem unable to cope with the rising tide of (= large increase in ) car crime.
sentences.chinese: 面对日益增多的汽车罪案，警方似乎无能为力。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in number, amount, or value
an increase in number, amount, or value

sentences.english: We heard a lion roar.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到狮子在吼叫。

sentences.english: The engines roared.
sentences.chinese: 引擎轰鸣。

sentences.english: ‘Get out of my house!’ he roared.
sentences.chinese: “从我家里滚出去！”他吼道。

sentences.english: the roar of the crowd
sentences.chinese: 人群的喊叫声

detailed_translations.english: to make a deep, very loud noise
a deep, loud noise made by an animal such as a lion, or by someone’s voice

sentences.english: ‘Tom always sends me red roses on my birthday.’ ‘How romantic!’
sentences.chinese: “我过生日时汤姆总是给我送红玫瑰。”“多浪漫啊！”

detailed_translations.english: showing strong feelings of love

sentences.english: They tied a rope around my waist and pulled me up.
sentences.chinese: 他们在我腰间系了一根粗绳子，把我拉了上去。

sentences.english: The man was coiling a length of rope.
sentences.chinese: 那人正在卷一段绳子。

detailed_translations.english: very strong thick string, made by twisting together many thinner strings
to tie things together using rope

sentences.english: a dozen red roses
sentences.chinese: 一打红玫瑰

sentences.english: A large bouquet of roses arrived on her desk.
sentences.chinese: 一大束玫瑰送到了她的桌子上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 玫瑰；粉红色；蔷薇（花）；粉红色的葡萄酒
detailed_translations.english: a flower that often has a pleasant smell, and is usually red, pink, white, or yellow, or the bush that this flower grows on

detailed_translations.chinese: 玫瑰花的；玫瑰色的；粉红色的；带有玫瑰香味的
detailed_translations.english: pink in colour

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成玫瑰色，使（面颊）发红；使有玫瑰香味
detailed_translations.english: to make rose-coloured; cause to blush or redden

detailed_translations.chinese: 起义( rise的过去式)；升起；（数量）增加；休会

name: rough
trans: adj.粗糙的，粗略的，粗暴的 ；adv.粗糙地

sentences.english: Her hands were rough from hard work.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手因为干重活而变得很粗糙。

sentences.english: the rough terrain at the base of the mountains
sentences.chinese: 山脚下崎岖不平的地形

sentences.english: We were bumping over the rough ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们在崎岖的地面上颠簸而行。

sentences.english: a rough translation
sentences.chinese: 粗略的翻译

detailed_translations.english: having an uneven surface

name: rouse
trans: v.唤醒，激起，使振奋 ；n .觉醒，奋起

sentences.english: His banging roused the neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 他重重的关门声把邻居都吵醒了。

detailed_translations.english: to wake someone who is sleeping deeply

sentences.english: a long-distance runner
sentences.chinese: 长跑运动员

sentences.english: a marathon runner
sentences.chinese: 马拉松运动员

detailed_translations.chinese: 跑步者；走私者；推销员；送信人
detailed_translations.english: someone who runs for sport or pleasure

name: rush
trans: n . 匆促， 冲进；vi. 冲， 奔， 闯 ， 涌现

sentences.english: A small girl rushed past her.
sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩从她身边匆匆经过。

sentences.english: Mo rushed off down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 莫匆匆走过走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon
to do or decide something too quickly, especially so that you do not have time to do it carefully or well

name: sacrifice
trans: n .牺牲，献身；v.牺牲，献出，供奉

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

sentences.english: There was a touch of sadness in his voice (= he sounded a little sad ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的声音里含着一丝悲伤。

sentences.english: His relief was tinged with sadness (= he also felt rather sad ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的欣慰中带着一丝哀伤。

detailed_translations.english: the state of feeling sad

sentences.english: You shouldn’t travel alone, for safety’s sake .
sentences.chinese: 为安全起见，不要独自一人旅行。

sentences.english: For your own safety , please do not smoke inside the plane.
sentences.chinese: 为了您自身的安全，请不要在飞机上吸烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安全；保险；安全设备；保险装置；安打
detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is safe from danger or harm

name: sailor
trans: n . 海员，水手，  船员

sentences.english: Six British sailors drowned.
sentences.chinese: 六名英国海员溺水身亡。

sentences.english: We were both experienced sailors.
sentences.chinese: 我们两个都是经验丰富的水手。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works on a ship

sentences.english: Would you like some salad with your pasta?
sentences.chinese: 你的意大利面要配些色拉吗？

sentences.english: a spinach salad
sentences.chinese: 菠菜色拉

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of raw vegetables, especially  lettuce  ,  cucumber  , and tomato

name: sale
trans: n . 出售， 卖出，销售； 过去式 sold ，过去分词 sold

sentences.english: Harvey gets a $50 commission every time he makes a sale (= sells something as part of his job ) .
sentences.chinese: 哈维每做成一笔生意可得到50美元的佣金。

sentences.english: Car salesmen will often bring down the price rather than lose a sale (= fail to sell something ) .
sentences.chinese: 汽车推销员常常宁愿降价也不愿失去一笔生意。

sentences.english: arms sales to Iran
sentences.chinese: 对伊朗的军火销售

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；出售；拍卖；销售额；廉价出售
detailed_translations.english: when you sell something

sentences.english: This might need some salt and pepper.
sentences.chinese: 这里面也许要加点盐和胡椒粉。

sentences.english: a pinch of salt
sentences.chinese: 一撮盐

sentences.english: Could you pass the salt?
sentences.chinese: 递一下盐好吗？

detailed_translations.english: a natural white mineral that is added to food to make it taste better or to preserve it

detailed_translations.chinese: 咸水的；含盐的，咸味的；盐腌的；猥亵的
detailed_translations.english: preserved with salt

detailed_translations.chinese: 用盐腌；给…加盐；将盐撒在道路上使冰或雪融化
detailed_translations.english: to add salt to food to make it taste better

name: sample
trans: n .标本，样品，例子；vt .取样，采样

sentences.english: They took a blood sample to test for hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: 他们取了血样做肝炎化验。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that is examined in order to find out something about the whole

detailed_translations.chinese: 从…抽样； 品尝， 体验
detailed_translations.english: to taste food or drink in order to see what it is like

sentences.english: Carefully split the sponge ring, then sandwich the two halves together with whipped cream.
sentences.chinese: 小心地切开海绵蛋糕圈，然后在两半中间夹上生奶油。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夹入；挤进；把做成三明治
detailed_translations.english: If you sandwich two things together with something else, you put that other thing between them. If you sandwich one thing between two other things, you put it between them.
two pieces of bread with cheese, meat, cooked egg etc between them

name: satisfaction
trans: n . 满意， 满足，令人满意的事物

sentences.english: She got great satisfaction from helping people to learn.
sentences.chinese: 她在帮助人们学习的过程中得到很大的满足。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of happiness or pleasure because you have achieved something or got what you wanted

name: scene
trans: n .现场， 场面， 情景

sentences.english: Hamlet, Act 5 Scene 2
sentences.chinese: 《哈姆雷特》第5幕第2场

sentences.english: battle scenes
sentences.chinese: 战斗场面

sentences.english: The police soon arrived at the scene of the crime .
sentences.chinese: 警察很快就到达了案发现场。

sentences.english: He photographed a wide range of street scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他拍下了丰富多彩的街景。

detailed_translations.english: part of a play during which there is no change in time or place

sentences.english: At half-time the score was one all.
sentences.chinese: 半场时的比分是一比一。

sentences.english: What’s the score?
sentences.chinese: 比分是多少？

sentences.english: Is anybody keeping score (= making a record of the score ) ?
sentences.chinese: 有没有人负责记分？

sentences.english: The final score was Southampton two, Leeds United nil.
sentences.chinese: 最后的比分是二比零，南安普敦队击败利兹联队。

sentences.english: The school’s test scores have not improved.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的考试成绩没有提高。

detailed_translations.english: the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition

sentences.english: Jay stripped his clothes off and ran into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 杰伊脱光衣服奔入海里。

sentences.english: Most exports went by sea .
sentences.chinese: 大部分出口商品都走海路。

sentences.english: a little cottage by the sea
sentences.chinese: 一座海滨小屋

sentences.english: He spent over 30 years at sea .
sentences.chinese: 他在船上工作了30多年。

sentences.english: They stood side by side looking out to sea .
sentences.chinese: 他们并排站着眺望大海。

detailed_translations.english: the large area of salty water that covers much of the Earth’s surface

name: second
trans: n .秒， 片刻 ， 第二者， 第二人；  num. 第二

sentences.english: Any proposal must be seconded by two other members of the committee.
sentences.chinese: 任何提案须有委员会其他两位委员附议。

detailed_translations.english: to formally support a suggestion made by another person in a meeting

name: secret
trans: n .秘密 ， 奥秘； adj.秘密的， 隐秘的；<衍生词> secretly adv.秘密地， 背地里

sentences.english: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.
sentences.chinese: 我不能告诉你，这是个秘密。

sentences.english: It was no secret that the two men hated each other.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男人相互仇视，这算不得什么秘密。

sentences.english: Don’t worry. Your secret is safe with me (= I won’t tell anyone about it ) .
sentences.chinese: 别担心，我会替你保守秘密。

sentences.english: Your hair always looks so great – what’s your secret ?
sentences.chinese: 你的头发看起来总是很漂亮——你的秘诀是什么？

sentences.english: They kept their relationship secret from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩的关系瞒着父母。

detailed_translations.english: something that is kept hidden or that is known about by only a few people
known about by only a few people and kept hidden from others

sentences.english: Suddenly he seized my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他突然抓住我的手。

sentences.english: The rebels have seized power.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

sentences.english: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

detailed_translations.english: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

name: self
trans: n . 自己，  自我， 本质， 本人

sentences.english: a child’s developing sense of self
sentences.chinese: 儿童逐渐形成的自我意识

detailed_translations.english: the type of person you are, your character, your typical behaviour etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 使自花授精；使近亲繁殖

name: sense
trans: n .感觉， 见识 ， 意义

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.english: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.english: This is true in a general sense.
sentences.chinese: 从一般意义上来讲，这是对的。

sentences.english: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感官；感觉；理解力；判断力；意义
detailed_translations.english: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

sentences.english: She received an eight-year prison sentence.
sentences.chinese: 她被判八年徒刑。

sentences.english: He has just begun a life sentence for murder.
sentences.chinese: 他犯了谋杀罪，刚开始服无期徒刑。

sentences.english: Sanchez was sentenced to three years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 桑切斯被判了三年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment that a judge gives to someone who is guilty of a crime
if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment

name: separate
trans: adj.分开的，分离的；v.分开， 隔离

sentences.english: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
sentences.chinese: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

detailed_translations.english: not joined to or touching something else

sentences.english: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

sentences.english: the serious problem of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 严重的失业问题

sentences.english: Luckily, the damage was not serious.
sentences.chinese: 还好，损坏不算严重。

sentences.english: Serious crimes have increased dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 重大犯罪案件大幅度增加了。

sentences.english: Oil spills pose a serious threat to marine life.
sentences.chinese: 原油泄漏对海洋生物构成了严重威胁。

sentences.english: The president was in serious trouble .
sentences.chinese: 总统遇到大麻烦了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，严重的；认真的；庄重的；危急的
detailed_translations.english: a serious situation, problem, accident etc is extremely bad or dangerous

sentences.english: Board members met in closed session (= with nobody else present ) .
sentences.chinese: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

name: set
trans: v.放置，提出，树立 ；  n .一套，一副

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics

name: settle
trans: vt .安放，使定居，安排 ；vi.安家， 定居，停留

sentences.english: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们静下来后，布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves (= stop herself from feeling worried or frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定
detailed_translations.english: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm

sentences.english: The women visited cities in seven states.
sentences.chinese: 这些女性访问了七个州的城市。

sentences.english: We close the store at seven (= seven o’clock ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们商店七点关门。

sentences.english: ‘How old’s Sam?’ ‘He’s seven (= seven years old ) .’
sentences.chinese: “萨姆多大了？”“他七岁。”

detailed_translations.english: the number 7
the number 7

sentences.english: We lost touch during the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 我们在70年代失去了联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 七十；七十个；七十岁；七十年代
detailed_translations.english: the number 70

detailed_translations.chinese: 七十的；七十个的；七十岁的

detailed_translations.english: the number 70

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: shake
trans: v.摇动 ，颤抖 ；n . 颤抖，震动

sentences.english: She shook him to wake him up.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇他，想把他叫醒。

sentences.english: Shake the bottle before you open it.
sentences.chinese: 打开瓶子之前先摇一摇。

sentences.english: The whole house started to shake.
sentences.chinese: 整幢房子摇晃起来。

sentences.english: The car shook as it went over a bump.
sentences.chinese: 汽车驶过一个隆起的地方时颠了一下。

sentences.english: The little boy’s hand was shaking.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩的手在发抖。

sentences.english: Give the bottle a good shake before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前要用力摇晃瓶子

sentences.english: His confidence was badly shaken.
sentences.chinese: 他的自信心受到很大的打击。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this
if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side

name: shape
trans: n .外形，形状，形态；  vt .制作，使成形， 塑造

sentences.english: What shape is the table?
sentences.chinese: 那张桌子是什么形状的？

sentences.english: You can recognize a tree by the shape of its leaves.
sentences.chinese: 可以根据树叶的形状辨认出是什么树。

sentences.english: His battered old hat had completely lost its shape.
sentences.chinese: 他那顶破旧的帽子已经完全变形了。

sentences.english: The plants grow in every shape and size .
sentences.chinese: 这些植物有各种形状，各种大小。

sentences.english: The children cut out shapes (= squares, triangles etc ) from the piece of cardboard.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们把卡纸片剪成各种形状。

detailed_translations.english: the form that something has, for example round, square,  triangular  etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成；塑造，使成形；使符合
detailed_translations.english: to influence something such as a belief, opinion etc and make it develop in a particular way

name: sharp
trans: n .利刃； adj.锐利的，锋利的， 强烈的

sentences.english: Make sure you use a good sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要用锋利的好刀。

sentences.english: Its teeth are razor sharp (= very sharp ) .
sentences.chinese: 它的牙齿非常锋利。

sentences.english: Do not cross the bridge but turn sharp left to go down on to the towpath.
sentences.chinese: 不要过桥，而是向左急转下到纤道上去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
detailed_translations.english: having a very thin edge or point that can cut things easily
Sharp is also an adverb

name: shelter
trans: n .掩蔽处，庇护所；  掩蔽

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

name: shift
trans: n . 轮班， 改变，手段；v. 转移，转换，移动，转变

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

name: shine
trans: v. 照耀， 发光；vt .擦亮； n .光泽，光亮

sentences.english: The sun was shining .
sentences.chinese: 阳光照耀。

sentences.english: The moon shone brightly in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 皓月当空。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发出光；反射光，闪耀；出类拔萃，表现突出；露出；照耀；显露；出众
detailed_translations.english: to produce bright light

detailed_translations.chinese: 光亮，光泽；好天气；擦亮；晴天；擦皮鞋；鬼把戏或诡计
detailed_translations.english: the brightness that something has when light shines on it

sentences.english: We'll ship your order to the address we print on your cheques.
sentences.chinese: 我们将把你预订的货物送到我们印在你单据上的地址。

detailed_translations.english: to send goods somewhere by ship, plane, truck etc
a large boat used for carrying people or goods across the sea

sentences.english: I have to wear a shirt and tie to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班要穿衬衫打领带。

sentences.english: a check shirt
sentences.chinese: 格子衬衫

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that covers the upper part of your body and your arms, usually has a collar, and is fastened at the front by buttons

sentences.english: The hatred in her voice shocked him.
sentences.chinese: 她语气中的仇恨让他震惊。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very surprised and upset, and unable to believe what has happened

sentences.english: I sat down and took off my shoes and socks.
sentences.chinese: 我坐下来脱掉鞋子和袜子。

sentences.english: What size shoes do you take?
sentences.chinese: 你穿几号的鞋子？

detailed_translations.english: something that you wear to cover your feet, made of leather or some other strong material

sentences.english: The streets were crowded with shoppers.
sentences.chinese: 街上挤满了购物的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys things in shops

sentences.english: There is no heating available due to fuel shortages.
sentences.chinese: 因为燃料短缺，所以没有供暖。

sentences.english: There is no shortage of funds.
sentences.chinese: 不缺资金。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is not enough of something that people need

sentences.english: Peter was painfully aware of his own shortcomings.
sentences.chinese: 彼得痛苦地认识到了自己的短处。

detailed_translations.english: a fault or weakness that makes someone or something less successful or effective than they should be

sentences.english: The residents are being asked to shoulder the costs of the repairs.
sentences.chinese: 居民们被要求承担这笔修理费用。

sentences.english: They shouldered the boat and took it down to the river.
sentences.chinese: 他们把船扛在肩上抬到河里。

detailed_translations.english: to accept a difficult or unpleasant responsibility, duty etc

name: shout
trans: v.呼喊，呼叫； n .呼喊，呼叫

sentences.english: There’s no need to shout! I can hear you!
sentences.chinese: 用不着大声喊叫！我听得见！

sentences.english: ‘Watch out!’she shouted, as the car started to move.
sentences.chinese: “小心！”汽车开动时，她大声喊道。

detailed_translations.english: to say something very loudly
a loud call expressing anger, pain, excitement etc

sentences.english: I endured the shyness and the pain of jealousness.
sentences.chinese: 我既忍受着羞怯，又忍受着嫉妒的折磨；

sentences.english: When my play was with thee I never questioned who thou wert. I knew nor shyness nor fear, my life was boisterous.
sentences.chinese: 当我是同你做游戏的时候，我从来没有问过你是谁．我不懂得羞怯和惧怕，我的生活是热闹的．

name: side
trans: n .边， 旁边，侧面 ，一方 ；adj. 旁边的，侧面的

sentences.english: Fuel is cheaper on the French side of the border.
sentences.chinese: 燃料在边境那边的法国要便宜些。

sentences.english: A man stood watching me from the other side of the road.
sentences.chinese: 有个男人站在马路的对面看着我。

sentences.english: His friends and family were all on the other side of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友和家人都在地球的另一边。

sentences.english: The restaurant was empty apart from another couple on the far side of the room (= the area that is furthest away from you ) .
sentences.chinese: 饭店里空空的，只有最那边还有一对夫妇。

sentences.english: He is in charge of the civilian side of the UN mission.
sentences.chinese: 他在联合国使团中负责平民方面的事务。

sentences.english: Frank sided with David against their mother.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克站在戴维一边反对妈妈。

sentences.english: Hannah slipped out through a side exit.
sentences.chinese: 汉娜从一个侧门溜了出去。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two areas that are on the left or the right of an imaginary line, or on the left or the right of a border, wall, river etc
to support or argue against a person or group in a quarrel, fight etc
in or on the side of something

name: sight
trans: n .视力，视觉， 见， 瞥见

sentences.english: Anne’s sight is very good for someone of her age.
sentences.chinese: 安妮的视力对于她这个年龄的人来说算是非常好的。

sentences.english: He began to lose his sight six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前他开始视力衰退。

sentences.english: an emergency operation to save his sight
sentences.chinese: 挽救他视力的紧急手术

sentences.english: You will get a free sight test if you are under 16.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不满16岁，可以免费检查视力。

detailed_translations.english: the physical ability to see
to see something from a long distance away, or see something you have been looking for

name: sign
trans: n .标记，符号，记号 ；v.签名，署名 ，

sentences.english: the dollar sign
sentences.chinese: 美元符号

sentences.english: a minus sign
sentences.chinese: 减号

sentences.english: a sign on the door
sentences.chinese: 门上的标牌

sentences.english: Sign here, please.
sentences.chinese: 请在这里签字。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present

sentences.english: He pressed the red alarm signal to see if it was on or off.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下红色报警信号钮，检查一下它是开著的还是关著的。

detailed_translations.english: important
a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something
to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

sentences.english: Stop asking silly questions.
sentences.chinese: 别再问傻问题了。

sentences.english: You made a lot of silly mistakes .
sentences.chinese: 你犯了许多愚蠢的错误。

sentences.english: I left my keys at home, which was a pretty silly thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 我干了件傻事，把钥匙落在家里了。

sentences.english: ‘Shall we go for a walk?’ ‘ Don’t be silly , it’s dark.’
sentences.chinese: “我们去散步吧？”“别犯傻了，天都黑了。”

detailed_translations.english: not sensible, or showing bad judgment

sentences.english: They are both blonde, but there the similarity ends .
sentences.chinese: 他们俩都是金发，但相同之处也就仅此而已。

detailed_translations.english: if there is a similarity between two things or people, they are similar in some way

name: since
trans: adv. 以后，后来，  以前；  prep . 自从，  自... 以来；  conj. 自... 以来，  因为

sentences.english: We’ve been waiting here since two o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 我们从两点钟开始就在这里等了。

sentences.english: I haven’t played rugby since I left university.
sentences.chinese: 我大学毕业后就没打过橄榄球。

sentences.english: She left London ten years ago, and I haven’t seen her since.
sentences.chinese: 她十年前离开伦敦，此后我再没有见过她。

sentences.english: The factory has been here since the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂从 20 世纪 70 年代起就在这里了。

sentences.english: It was exactly five years since her father had died.
sentences.chinese: 从她父亲去世到现在正好满五年。

sentences.english: Since the end of the war, over five thousand prisoners have been released.
sentences.chinese: 自从战争结束以后，已有五千多名战俘获释。

sentences.english: He lost his job five years ago, but has since found other work.
sentences.chinese: 他五年前失去工作，但此后找到了其他工作。

sentences.english: I left school in 1995, and since then I’ve lived in London.
sentences.chinese: 我 1995 年离开学校，此后就在伦敦生活。

sentences.english: About six thousand people were arrested, several hundred of whom have since been released.
sentences.chinese: 约六千人被逮捕，不过他们中有几百人后来被释放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因为；由于；既然；自…以来；自…以后

detailed_translations.english: from a particular time or event in the past until the present, or in that period of time
When you are talking about an event or situation in the past, you use since to indicate that another event happened at some point later in time

sentences.english: She can sing beautifully.
sentences.chinese: 她唱歌很好听。

sentences.english: Most children enjoy singing.
sentences.chinese: 大多数孩子都喜欢唱歌。

sentences.english: We had a great time singing some of the old songs .
sentences.chinese: 我们唱了一些老歌，非常开心。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to sing in tune (= sing the correct notes ) .
sentences.chinese: 我唱歌总是跑调。

sentences.english: She patiently sang the baby to sleep .
sentences.chinese: 她耐心地唱歌哄宝宝入睡。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a musical sound with your voice

sentences.english: A single tree gave shade from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 唯有一棵树遮阴。

sentences.english: They won the game by a single point.
sentences.chinese: 他们仅以一分的优势赢得比赛。

sentences.english: the highest price ever paid for a single work of art
sentences.chinese: 为单件艺术品所支付的最高价格

sentences.english: a single-sex school
sentences.chinese: 单一性别的学校

detailed_translations.english: only one
a ticket for a trip from one place to another but not back again

sentences.english: Janet and Abby are sisters.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮特和阿比是两姐妹。

sentences.english: He has two sisters and a brother.
sentences.chinese: 他有两个姊妹和一个弟弟。

sentences.english: She’s my twin sister .
sentences.chinese: 她是我的孪生妹妹。

sentences.english: ...the International Monetary Fund and its sister organization, the World Bank.
sentences.chinese: …国际货币基金组织和它的姐妹机构，世界银行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 姐妹；（称志同道合者）姐妹；修女；护士
detailed_translations.english: a girl or woman who has the same parents as you
You can use sister to describe something that is of the same type or is connected in some way to another thing you have mentioned. For example, if a company has a sister company, they are connected.

sentences.english: an archaeological site
sentences.chinese: 考古现场

detailed_translations.english: a place where something important or interesting happened
to place or build something in a particular place

sentences.english: six months ago
sentences.chinese: 六个月前

sentences.english: She arrived just after six (= six o’clock ) .
sentences.chinese: 她六点刚过就到了。

sentences.english: He learnt to play the violin when he was six (= six years old ) .
sentences.chinese: 他六岁学拉小提琴。

detailed_translations.english: the number 6
the number 6

name: size
trans: n . 大小，尺寸 ，衣服等尺码

sentences.english: He’s a small boy, about John’s size.
sentences.chinese: 他是个小男孩，个子和约翰差不多。

sentences.english: Jensens’ house is about the same size as ours.
sentences.chinese: 詹森的房子和我们的差不多大。

sentences.english: He’s quite a big dog, but he’s still not full size yet.
sentences.chinese: 这条狗体型很大，但还没有长足。

detailed_translations.english: how big or small something is
to sort according to size

sentences.english: She wore a white blouse and a plain black skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着白衬衣和纯黑的裙子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of outer clothing worn by women and girls, which hangs down from the waist like the bottom part of a dress
to avoid talking about an important subject, especially because it is difficult or embarrassing – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: a slave to fashion
sentences.chinese: 时尚的奴隶

detailed_translations.english: someone who is owned by another person and works for them for no money
to work very hard with little time to rest

name: slavery
trans: n .奴隶身份，奴隶制度，苦役

sentences.english: attempts to abolish slavery
sentences.chinese: 废除奴隶制的努力

detailed_translations.english: the system of having slaves

name: slender
trans: adj. 苗条的，微薄的，微弱的

sentences.english: She is slender and stylish.
sentences.chinese: 她身材修长，穿着时髦。

sentences.english: The company only has a slender hope of survival.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司维持下去的希望很渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: thin in an attractive or graceful way

sentences.english: Ben slipped quietly out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 本悄悄地溜出了房间。

sentences.english: One man managed to slip from the club as police arrived.
sentences.chinese: 警察到来时，一个男子设法溜出了俱乐部。

sentences.english: We must be well prepared, there must be no slips.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须好好准备，一定不要有差错。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滑跤，滑落，溜；下降，跌落；悄悄放进
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere, without attracting other people’s attention
A slip is a small or unimportant mistake

sentences.english: an advertising slogan
sentences.chinese: 一句广告口号

sentences.english: demonstrators shouting political slogans
sentences.chinese: 高喊政治口号的示威者

sentences.english: the Democrats’ campaign slogan
sentences.chinese: 民主党的竞选口号

detailed_translations.english: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used in advertisements, or by politicians, organizations etc

sentences.english: He shook his head slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地摇了摇头。

sentences.english: ‘That’s true,’ said Joe slowly.
sentences.chinese: “没错。”乔慢吞吞地说道。

detailed_translations.english: at a slow speed

name: smell
trans: n . 气味，嗅觉；v.嗅， 闻到

sentences.english: I can smell burning.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到烧焦的气味。

sentences.english: Can you smell something?
sentences.chinese: 你闻到什么气味了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to notice or recognize a particular smell
the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose

sentences.english: I don’t smoke and I don’t drink much.
sentences.chinese: 我不吸烟，酒也喝得不多。

sentences.english: Do you mind if I smoke?
sentences.chinese: 我抽烟你介意吗？

sentences.english: He sat on the grass smoking a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在草地上吸烟。

sentences.english: He admitted that he had smoked marijuana when he was a student.
sentences.chinese: 他承认在读书时吸过大麻。

sentences.english: a smoking chimney
sentences.chinese: 冒烟的烟囱

sentences.english: Smoke from burning fields drifted across nearby roads.
sentences.chinese: 地里燃烧产生的烟雾飘到了附近的公路上。

detailed_translations.english: to suck or breathe in smoke from a cigarette, pipe etc or to do this regularly as a habit
white, grey or black gas that is produced by something burning

name: smooth
trans: adj.平滑的 ，平稳的 ，安祥的；vt .使光滑

sentences.english: Her skin felt smooth and cool.
sentences.chinese: 她的皮肤摸上去又滑又凉。

sentences.english: a smooth pebble
sentences.chinese: 光滑的卵石

sentences.english: The stone steps had been worn smooth .
sentences.chinese: 石阶被磨得光溜溜的了。

sentences.english: She stood up and smoothed down her frock.
sentences.chinese: 她站了起来，抚平了自己的连衣裙。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth surface has no rough parts, lumps, or holes, especially in a way that is pleasant and attractive to touch

detailed_translations.chinese: 使光滑；消除（障碍等）；使优雅；缓和
detailed_translations.english: to make a rough surface flat and even
If you smooth something, you move your hands over its surface to make it smooth and flat

sentences.english: Snow was falling heavily as we entered the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们进村的时候雪下得正大。

sentences.english: I could see footprints in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 我看到雪地里有脚印。

sentences.english: The town was buried under three feet of snow.
sentences.chinese: 小镇被三英尺厚的积雪覆盖着。

detailed_translations.english: soft white pieces of frozen water that fall from the sky in cold weather and cover the ground
if it snows, snow falls from the sky

sentences.english: Wash thoroughly with soap and water .
sentences.chinese: 用肥皂和水彻底洗一洗。

sentences.english: a bar of soap
sentences.chinese: 一块肥皂

detailed_translations.english: the substance that you use to wash your body

detailed_translations.chinese: 将肥皂涂在……上；对……拍马屁（俚语）
detailed_translations.english: to rub soap on or over someone or something

sentences.english: technology and its effects on modern society
sentences.chinese: 科技及其对现代社会的影响

sentences.english: Children are the most vulnerable members of society .
sentences.chinese: 儿童是最脆弱的社会成员。

detailed_translations.english: people in general, considered in relation to the laws, organizations etc that make it possible for them to live together

sentences.english: a pair of socks
sentences.chinese: 一双短袜

sentences.english: white ankle socks
sentences.chinese: 白色的齐踝短袜

sentences.english: Once, after a boy made a comment, she socked him.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，一个男孩子发表了一点意见，她就挥拳猛击他。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing made of soft material that you wear on your foot inside your shoe
If you sock someone or something, you hit them hard

name: soft
trans: adj.柔软的， 温和的，不含酒精的

sentences.english: a baby’s soft skin
sentences.chinese: 婴儿细嫩的皮肤

sentences.english: The fur was soft to the touch.
sentences.chinese: 这皮毛摸起来很柔滑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 软的，柔软的；温柔的，温和的；软弱的；笨的
detailed_translations.english: having a surface that is smooth and pleasant to touch

detailed_translations.chinese: 柔性；柔软的东西；柔软部分

name: soil
trans: n .土壤，土地，  国土；v.弄脏， 污辱

sentences.english: She moistenend  the soil round the plant.
sentences.chinese: 她把植物周围的土壤弄湿。

detailed_translations.english: to make something dirty, especially with waste from your body
to make something dirty, especially with waste from your body

sentences.english: A British soldier was wounded in the fighting.
sentences.chinese: 战斗中，有一名英国士兵受了伤。

sentences.english: an enemy soldier
sentences.chinese: 敌兵

detailed_translations.chinese: 军人；[昆] 兵蚁；懒汉；一片烤面包
detailed_translations.english: a member of the army of a country, especially someone who is not an officer

detailed_translations.chinese: 当兵；磨洋工；坚持干；假称害病

sentences.english: I’d like to visit Japan someday.
sentences.chinese: 我想将来有一天去日本。

sentences.english: He hopes, someday, to have his own business.
sentences.chinese: 他希望有一天能够拥有自己的公司。

detailed_translations.english: at an unknown time in the future, especially a long time in the future

sentences.english: My wallet must be around here somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 我的钱包肯定是在这里的什么地方。

sentences.english: We could meet for dinner at Giorgio’s or somewhere (= or a similar place ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在乔治家或别的什么地方一起吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: in or to a place, but you do not say or know exactly where

sentences.english: Her son Sean was born in 1983.
sentences.chinese: 她的儿子肖恩出生于 1983 年。

sentences.english: They have three sons and a daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他们有三个儿子和一个女儿。

sentences.english: In those days, the property went to the oldest son.
sentences.chinese: 那时候，财产由长子继承。

sentences.english: their youngest son, George
sentences.chinese: 他们最小的儿子乔治

detailed_translations.chinese: 儿子；孩子（对年轻人的称呼）；男性后裔
detailed_translations.english: someone’s male child

sentences.english: It will be dark soon.
sentences.chinese: 天很快就要黑了。

sentences.english: David arrived sooner than I expected.
sentences.chinese: 戴维到得比我预料的快。

sentences.english: ‘Who?’ ‘You’ll find out soon enough (= fairly soon ) .’
sentences.chinese: “谁？”“你很快就会知道的。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 快；不久，一会儿；立刻；宁愿
detailed_translations.english: in a short time from now, or a short time after something else happens

name: sore
trans: adj.疼痛的，剧烈的； n .痛的地方

sentences.english: I had a sore throat and aching limbs.
sentences.chinese: 我喉咙疼，四肢酸痛。

sentences.english: Mac’s still sore because I didn’t invite him.
sentences.chinese: 马克还在因为我没邀请他而生气呢。

sentences.english: They were starving and covered with sores.
sentences.chinese: 他们在挨饿，身上长满了疮。

detailed_translations.english: a part of your body that is sore is painful, because of infection or because you have used a muscle too much
a painful, often red, place on your body caused by a wound or infection

sentences.english: She was very sorry about all the trouble she'd caused.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己造成的麻烦感到很内疚。

trans: n .翅膀，机翼；vt .飞过 ， 空运，增加...速度；vi.飞行

sentences.english: a butterfly with beautiful markings on its wings
sentences.chinese: 翅膀上有美丽花纹的蝴蝶

sentences.english: The pheasant flapped its wings vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 野鸡猛烈地拍打翅膀。

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts of a bird’s or insect’s body that it uses for flying
to fly somewhere

sentences.english: a man of great wisdom
sentences.chinese: 一个有大智慧的男人

sentences.english: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

detailed_translations.english: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

name: wood
trans: n .木头 ；<衍生词> wooden adj.木制的

sentences.english: Put some more wood on the fire.
sentences.chinese: 往火上再添些木柴。

sentences.english: a polished wood floor
sentences.chinese: 擦得锃亮的木地板

sentences.english: Her house was made of wood .
sentences.chinese: 她家的房子是木头盖的。

detailed_translations.english: the material that trees are made of

sentences.english: a hundred yards away
sentences.chinese: 100码外

sentences.english: an area of 9,000 square yards
sentences.chinese: 面积为9,000平方码的一片区域

detailed_translations.chinese: 院子；码（英制中丈量长度单位，1码=3英尺）；庭院；帆桁
detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length, equal to three feet or 0.91 metres

name: yell
trans: vi. 大喊大叫； n . 叫喊声

sentences.english: ‘Help me!’ she yelled hysterically.
sentences.chinese: “救救我！”她歇斯底里地大叫。

sentences.english: I yelled out, ‘Here I am!’
sentences.chinese: 我大声喊道:“我在这儿！”

sentences.english: The crowd are on their feet yelling.
sentences.chinese: 观众站着高声呐喊。

sentences.english: He could hear Pete yelling at the top of his voice (= very loudly ).
sentences.chinese: 他听到皮特声嘶力竭地在喊叫。

detailed_translations.english: to shout or say something very loudly, especially because you are frightened, angry, or excited
a loud shout

sentences.english: ‘When’s your holiday?’ ‘Oh, not for ages yet.’
sentences.chinese: “你什么时候去休假？”“噢，不知何年何月呢。”

sentences.english: It could be months yet before they know their fate.
sentences.chinese: 可能要好几个月他们才能知道自己的命运。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how much time will pass before something happens, or how long a situation will continue
used to introduce a fact, situation, or quality that is surprising after what you have just said

sentences.english: Make x greater than or equal to zero.
sentences.chinese: 设x大于或等于零。

detailed_translations.english: the number 0
the number 0

sentences.english: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。

sentences.english: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

detailed_translations.english: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way

sentences.english: The road to the zoo turns off here.
sentences.chinese: 通向动物园的路由这儿拐弯。

sentences.english: The parrots in the zoo are popping all the time.
sentences.chinese: 动物园里的鹦鹉一直在生小鹦鹉。

sentences.english: Lionesses bearing cubs in the zoo is nothing new now.
sentences.chinese: 狮子在动物园繁殖早已屡见不鲜了。

detailed_translations.english: a place, usually in a city, where animals of many kinds are kept so that people can go to look at them
